name: DigitalPiano
tagline: Play music from Arduino using the accelerometer sensor of an Android device
body:
![](https://raw.github.com/solotsopa/DigitalPiano/master/Android/DigitalPiano/Android-Arduino/src/main/res/drawable-xhdpi/ic_launcher.png) ### Welcome to DigitalPiano app The DigitalPiano app is a combination of Android-Processing-Arduino applications which is playing piano in the speaker connected to the Arduino. The Android app is taking values from the accelerometer sensor and sends them to the Processing app via the WiFi network using Sockets. The Processing app is a simple server which forwards to the Arduino (using the Serial connection) the values which are taken from the Android app. The Arduino app takes the values from the Serial connection and depending to these values sends the corresponding note (pitch) to the connected speaker. ### Android app The Android app is taking values from the accelerometer sensor and sends them to the Processing app via the WiFi network using Sockets. There is a "Start Accelerator" button which starts the sensor and an input field to enter the ip of the server. If the server's ip is correct, up and running and the sensor is taking values of the x axis, the app makes a connection with the server and sends the x values in an absolute format (because if you tilt the device to the right, the x axis takes negative values). `SensorManager sensorManager = (SensorManager) getSystemService(SENSOR_SERVICE);`

`List sensors = sensorManager.getSensorList(Sensor.TYPE_ACCELEROMETER);` ### Processing app The Processing app is a simple server which forwards to the Arduino (using the Serial connection) the values. It creates a small window and starts the server socket waiting for incoming connections. If there is a connection, the app prints the ip of the client and forwards the incoming message to the Serial connection (in which the Arduino is connected). ### Arduino app The Arduino app takes the values from the Serial connection and depending to these values sends the corresponding note (pitch) to the connected speaker. The incoming values are between 0 and 9 and the Arduino app plays different note depending on theses values. ### Arduino Circuit To play music with your Arduino you need to have: an Arduino (any type), a breadboard (not necessary), a speaker and some breadboard wires. You have to connect the one cable of speaker to an Arduino pin and the other to the Ground. ![Arduino](https://raw.github.com/solotsopa/DigitalPiano/master/Arduino/DigitalPiano/arduino.jpg) ### Troubleshooting In the Processing code you have to change the Serial port list to the one which is connects your Computer with the Arduino. Change the _mySerialPortList_ `int mySerialPortList = 0; `

`String portName = Serial.list()[mySerialPortList]; ` In Arduino app code you have to change the pin to the one which you have connected the speaker in the Arduino. `int pin = 12;` ### Authors and Contributors Android and Processing app are designed and programmed by Apostolos Siokas (@solotsopa) ### Support or Contact For everything you can reach me at apostolossiokas@gmail.com
